t: A psalm; a dedication song for the house. Of David.
I*pn will exalt you, Lord,*s because*ln you have lifted me up and*ln have not allowed my enemies to*ln triumph over me.
Lord*sln my God, I*ln cried to you for help, and you healed me.
Lord,*sln you brought me up from Sheol; you*ln spared me from among those going*ln down to the Pit.
Sing*pn to the Lord,*s you his faithful ones, and*ln praise his holy name.
For*ln his anger lasts only a moment, but*ln his favor, a lifetime. Weeping*ln may stay overnight, but*ln there is joy in the morning.
When*pn I was secure, I said, “I*ln will never be shaken.”
Lord,*sln when you showed your favor, you*ln made me stand like a strong mountain; when*ln you hid your face, I was terrified.
Lord,*sln I called to you; I*ln sought favor from my Lord:
“What*ln gain is there in my death, if*ln I go down to the Pit? Will*ln the dust praise you? Will*ln it proclaim your truth?
Lord,*sln listen and be gracious to me; Lord,*sln be my helper.”
You*pn turned my lament into dancing; you*ln removed my sackcloth and*ln clothed me with gladness,
so*ln that I can sing to you and not be silent. Lord*sln my God, I will praise you forever.
